traceability.evidence: • bin/dry-aged-deps.js and src/print-outdated.js implement CLI flags (--prod-min-age, --dev-min-age, --prod-severity, --dev-severity), validation, dependency-type detection, fallback to general flags, default behavior, and output ‘Type’ column in table and XML. • No code reads a config file or supports a config schema ({ prod: {...}, dev: {...} }). • No tests exist for prod/dev threshold logic, fallback behavior, or precedence rules (search in test/ finds no prod- or dev-related tests). • README and help text document the new flags, but config file support is neither implemented nor documented.
traceability.notes: Key acceptance criteria are unimplemented: config file support (REQ-CONFIG-SCHEMA), corresponding precedence, and automated tests. Production/dev flags work, but without config file reading and tests the story is incomplete.
